question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the range of the function $$F(x) = |x+1|+|x-5|~?$$Express your answer in interval notation.
inference:
**Solution:** The function $F(x)=|x+1|+|x-5|$ is the sum of two absolute value functions. The range of the absolute value function is $[0,\infty)$, so the range of $F(x)$ is the set of all numbers that are the sum of two non-negative numbers. This set can be represented as the interval $[0,\infty)$.

**Final Answer: $\\boxed{[0,\infty)}$ I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth:
We have $$F(x) = \begin{cases}
-(x+1)-(x-5) &\text{if }x<-1 \\
(x+1)-(x-5) &\text{if }-1\le x<5 \\
(x+1)+(x-5) &\text{if }x\ge 5
\end{cases}.$$Simplifying, we have $$F(x) = \begin{cases}
4-2x &\text{if }x<-1 \\
6 &\text{if }-1\le x<5 \\
2x-4 &\text{if }x\ge 5
\end{cases}.$$For $x<-1,$ the function $4-2x$ achieves all values in $(6,\infty),$ and for $x\ge 5,$ the function $2x-4$ achieves all values in $[6,\infty).$Thus, the range of $F(x)$ is $\boxed{[6,\infty)}.$
